item.title: Frank sacked by Spurs after eight months in charge
item.description: Tottenham sack Thomas Frank as head coach after a run of only two wins in 17 Premier League matches.

item.title: De Zerbi leaves Marseille by mutual consent
item.description: Roberto de Zerbi, who led Marseille to second in Ligue 1 last season, leaves following their Champions League exit and a 5-0 defeat by Paris St-Germain.

item.title: How much pressure is Slot really under at Liverpool?
item.description: Liverpool have won just once in the Premier League in 2026 - so will they stick with Arne Slot, who took them to the title last season?

item.title: Has Milner's record become a problem for Brighton?
item.description: James Milner is one game away from drawing level with Gareth Barry for most Premier League appearances, but has the record become a problem for Brighton?

item.title: The 'rabbit in headlights' now excelling for Man City
item.description: Abdukodir Khusanov endured a nightmare debut for Manchester City but has since recovered to become a mainstay in the team.

item.title: Villa plotting Gibbs-White move - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Aston Villa are plotting a move for Morgan Gibbs-White, Liverpool's Mohamed Salah is a target for one of the Saudi Pro League's top clubs, Sandro Tonali's wages could be an obstacle for Serie A clubs, plus more.

item.title: Are Hearts developing the habit of champions?
item.description: Does Heart of Midlothian's late derby winner against Hibernian suggest they are developing the habit of champions as they go six points clear at the top of the Scottish Premiership?

item.title: Carrick's 'Sir Alex' playbook and a happy start at Man Utd
item.description: Michael Carrick is happy with his start as Manchester United head coach despite dropping his first points in 1-1 draw at West Ham.

item.title: Will Dyche steer Forest away from danger?
item.description: Sean Dyche was nominated for January's Manager of the Month yet it does not save the Nottingham Forest boss from uncertainty.

item.title: Grealish fined £1,000 after running red light
item.description: The footballer was caught on camera driving his Lamborghini supercar through the signals in Liverpool.

item.title: Watch Frank's final interview as Spurs boss
item.description: Watch Thomas Frank's final interview as Tottenham boss after being sacked following a dismal 2-1 defeat at home to Newcastle on Tuesday.

item.title: Why Frank at Tottenham was a gamble that ended in bitter failure
item.description: Thomas Frank's appointment by Tottenham was a gamble that ended in a storm of toxicity, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Boos after Newcastle hand Tottenham another home defeat
item.description: Tottenham fans are left frustrated as Newcastle inflict a seventh home defeat of the season on Thomas Frank's side.

item.title: After 493 days it is still 'no win, no trim' for Man Utd fan
item.description: A story about a haircut that has gone viral - meet Frank Ilett, the Manchester United fan with the infamous bouffant.

item.title: Can you name every Women's Champions League winner?
item.description: How well do you know the history of the Women's Champions League? Take our quiz to find out.

item.title: Howe savours 'special connection' with Newcastle fans after win at Spurs
item.description: Eddie Howe savours a "special connection" with fans after Newcastle win on the road at Spurs - in direct contrast to Tottenham's relationship with their manager.

item.title: 'Six minutes of madness' - Rosenior on losing two-goal lead
item.description: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior reflects on his side's 2-2 draw with Leeds United after conceding twice in "six minutes of madness".

item.title: 'Attitude best it's been' - Howe after win at Tottenham
item.description: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe praises his players for their attitude in their 2-1 win at Tottenham.

item.title: Man Utd not at 'our best' but positives to take away - Carrick
item.description: Michael Carrick says Manchester United "were not at their best" after a 1-1 draw at West Ham, but insists his side can "take away positives."

item.title: Iraola delighted with Rayan character
item.description: Bournemouth's Andoni Iraola is full of praise for new signing Rayan after he bounced back from conceding a penalty to score in their 2-1 comeback win against Everton.

item.title: Has Gyokeres finally found form or are stats misleading?
item.description: Arsenal are top of the league, fighting for trophies in four competitions and at the same time £64m striker Viktor Gyokeres looks to be finding his feet in north London.

item.title: Where do iconic football moves originate from?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain where the names of iconic football moves come from.

item.title: Everton disabled access 'a struggle', say fans
item.description: Some Everton fans with disabilities are considering giving up their season tickets due to access issues.

item.title: Haaland puts 'pressure on himself' to help team
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says Erling Haaland puts "pressure on himself" to consistently score because he "desperately wants to help the team".

item.title: Nuno disappointed not to hold on for win against Man Utd
item.description: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo says he's "disappointed" after a 1-1 draw with Manchester United, he states his side "played a good game, but today a win was not to be."

item.title: Leeds have a 'never say die attitude' - Farke
item.description: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke reacts to his side's 2-2 draw against Chelsea in the Premier League.

item.title: 'It's the referee's decision' - Moyes on red card
item.description: Everton boss David Moyes is disappointed his side gave up a 1-0 lead to lose against Bournemouth and refuses to be drawn on whether the referee made the right decision to send Jake O'Brien off.

item.title: 'I'm a freak of nature' - A day filming with Zlatan Ibrahimovic
item.description: Go behind the scenes with former Sweden and AC Milan footballer Zlatan Ibrahimovic, to see how the film for opening of the 2026 Winter Olympics was made.

item.title: Great for Premier League that there will be real jeopardy - Given
item.description: Mark Chapman is joined on the Monday Night Club by Shay Given, Chris Sutton and Rory Smith to discuss what impact - if any - Manchester City's late win at Liverpool has on Arsenal and the Premier League title race.

item.title: Man City produce late comeback to beat Liverpool in chaotic finale
item.description: Erling Haaland's 93rd-minute penalty gives Manchester City a crucial comeback win over Liverpool, who end the game with 10 men as Dominik Szoboszlai is sent off in stoppage time at Anfield.

item.title: 'Controlled chaos' as Boro overhaul Coventry at top
item.description: With 31 points from his 14 games in charge, Kim Hellberg has overseen a 12-point swing for Middlesbrough over previous Championship leaders Coventry City.

item.title: O'Neill hopes for full Celtic allocation at Ibrox
item.description: Manager Martin O'Neill hopes Celtic will receive the full ticket allocation available to them for the Scottish Cup tie at Ibrox.

item.title: Toughest season I've had as manager 'by a mile' - Slot
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says this season is the toughest he has had as a manager "by a mile" and his side are "not performing to Liverpool's standards".

item.title: How Aluko sparked women's football punditry debate
item.description: How former England foward Eni Aluko sparked a women's football punditry debate.

item.title: Snoop Dogg to attend Swansea game for first time
item.description: The musician will attend his first game since becoming a co-owner of the Championship club when they face Preston North End later this month.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup fourth round on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain how you can watch, listen and follow the FA Cup fourth round.

item.title: Motherwell v Rangers, O'Neill & Nygren in focus
item.description: Fourth-placed Motherwell and second-top Rangers meet in Wednesday's top Scottish Premiership fixture while Celtic's Martin O'Neill and Benjamin Nygren eye milestones against Livingston.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Ryder Cup star & Arsenal fan Ian Poulter
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on European Ryder Cup star Ian Poulter plus the BBC readers and AI with his predictions for this week's midweek Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Mateta knee injury 'not as bad as feared'
item.description: The knee injury which scuppered Jean-Philippe Mateta's move to AC Milan last month is "not as bad as feared" and he will not need surgery, says Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner.

item.title: Lyon loan helping 'explosive' Endrick's World Cup 'dream' with Brazil
item.description: Real Madrid striker Endrick's impact on loan at Lyon has been immediate, and is fuelling the teenager's "dream" of playing for Brazil at the World Cup.

item.title: Rohl heartened by Rangers' mindset shift
item.description: Rangers head coach Danny Rohl believes his side are far better equipped for big matches after seeing a winning mentality develop among his players in recent weeks.

item.title: 'You love Kobbie' - Mainoo showing Amorim why so many do
item.description: Why Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is proving Ruben Amorim was wrong to keep ignoring him.

item.title: Can you beat our Premier League top assisters quiz?
item.description: The list for most assists in a single Premier League season is so full of legends it inspired us to build this quiz.

item.title: Great attitude but goals have dried up - what's happened to Woltemade?
item.description: After an impressive start to life at Newcastle, what has happened to Nick Woltemade?

item.title: Late goals are destroying Liverpool's season and solution isn't obvious
item.description: Why have Liverpool gone from mentality monsters to a side there for the taking?

item.title: Why are Aberdeen taking so long to appoint a manager?
item.description: The club are still working to find Jimmy Thelin's successor, a month after the Swede's exit.

item.title: How Ekitike has already become a Liverpool cult hero
item.description: Inside the rise of Hugo Ekitike, adapting to life in England, connecting with Florian Wirtz and why he's already a fan favourite.

item.title: Inside Man City's rebuild and plan for life without Guardiola
item.description: BBC Sport looks at Manchester City's evolution and why the January window has offered renewed belief.

item.title: All February's done deals, including deadline day, in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: How does the Nations League work and when is the draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Uefa Nations League works ahead of the draw for the 2026-27 competition

item.title: What do you get for winning EFL Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the winner of the Carabao Cup gets.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: O'Neill expects Celtic overhaul - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Celtic interim manager Martin O'Neill says there will likely be an overhaul regarding recruitment and that the club has to be 'more robust' in their business.

item.title: Dundee United-Aberdeen match chances 'a fluid situation'
item.description: Dundee United say it is "a fluid situation" as they prepare to battle heavy rainfall in the hope of avoiding a postponement of Wednesday's Scottish Premiership fixture against Aberdeen.

item.title: Real Madrid's Weir made Scotland captain full-time
item.description: Caroline Weir is named Scotland captain on an official basis before the upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Luxembourg.

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: Quiz: Name the record transfer for every letter of the alphabet
item.description: When it comes to transfer windows, it's not all about the numbers - the letters are important too!

item.title: Lookman joins Atletico - and will set new record
item.description: Atletico Madrid sign Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman, 28, from Atalanta for £30.3m.

item.title: Real and England wait on Bellingham injury
item.description: Real Madrid are waiting to discover if midfielder Jude Bellingham faces a spell out after he suffers a muscle injury during the win against Rayo Vallecano.

item.title: Arsenal defender Zinchenko seals move to Ajax
item.description: Ajax sign Arsenal's Oleksandr Zinchenko on a permanent deal after the defender's season-long loan with Nottingham Forest is brought to an early end.

item.title: Barca president unhappy at teen's 'unpleasant' PSG move
item.description: PSG sign 18-year-old Barcelona midfielder Dro Fernandez, with the Spanish side's president calling the situation around the transfer "unpleasant".

item.title: Could Welsh rugby superstar's granddaughter play football for Wales?
item.description: Anna Powell, granddaughter of the rugby legend Barry John, has moved to Wales from Australia with a dream of playing top-level football.

item.title: Chelsea's head of women's football Green leaves club
item.description: Paul Green leaves his role as Chelsea's head of women's football after 13 years - and 19 trophies - with the Women's Super League club.

item.title: Smith's versatility and 'contagious' positivity driving Arsenal
item.description: Olivia Smith's talent and versatility is helping to kick-start a drifting Arsenal side back into life as they chase silverware on three fronts.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
